website_summaries.verdict: 70 adhesive square magnets holding up to 50 gram objects. 20 millimeters by 20 millimeters and 2 millimeters thick.
pros: Well-rated for versatile use: holding drawers closed, small tools, makeup palettes
cons: For some, overselling what the weight magnets can hold

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Magnets are not as strong as advertised. In addition they are not sticking to the surface (glue part) and they are falling off. I tried to return it but return cost more than the item... very disappointing taking into consideration the reviews... I would rate it 0 stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: NL

customer_reviews.title: and they worked great! They're a bit thick compared to the super-thin ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my Z palette, and they worked great! They're a bit thick compared to the super-thin metal magnets that came with the palette, but it doesn't affect closing the lid and they're strong enough to hold things safely in place, even when traveling!
customer_reviews.author: KitKat

customer_reviews.title: First World Magnet Problems...
customer_reviews.text: These do not hold very much weight at all. I can't seem to find strong enough magnets for the back of a small dry erase board to put on my fridge, the board is not very heavy either. These work to an extent but I have to place a larger magnet under the board otherwise it slides down, off the fridge. Not sure where to find such magnets but if anyone is reading this in the magnet business...a little help! I bought other magnets at a store and they weren't magnetized at all so I tried these, better but not great. Where does one obtain a decent magnet?!
customer_reviews.author: ADS

customer_reviews.title: No magnetism!
customer_reviews.text: These magnets have almost no magnetism. I had to use 21 magnets to hang a super light weight frame on the board.
customer_reviews.author: 54MH

customer_reviews.title: Work great!
customer_reviews.text: I used these for my pictures on the refrigerator to have a cleaner look rather then having a protruding and mismatched magnets. They are thick so i could defiantly use a thiner one once I run out. It would definitely hold paper card stuck up with no issues of sliding down.
customer_reviews.author: Jules Davis

customer_reviews.title: They don't stay adhered to anything
customer_reviews.text: They don't stay adhered to anything. I'm constantly having to put them back on something or finding them stuck on something else. I can't find anthing better so I just get these.
customer_reviews.author: Lovelle

customer_reviews.title: I teach a class of 10th Grade ENL students who ...
customer_reviews.text: I teach a class of 10th Grade ENL students who are very limited in speaking and reading English. I purchased these magnets to attach to letter and word cards to help them practice their English. The cards go up on the blackboard, and they practice unscrambling sentences with the words, and then reading them out loud, and the letters are used to play hangman where they solve sentences. They have improved so much! I will probably be buying more of these squares as their vocabulary increases! I am on my second set already!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Nicosia

customer_reviews.title: Not very strong magnets
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to hang an aluminium sign to a file cabinet. The sign is about the size of a standard bumper sticker. I had to use eight of these squares to provide enough sticking power for the sign to stay in place on the metal file cabinet. They are fine for holding up papers but expect to use more than one for most everything else. On the plus side, the adhesive has held strong and since I found the magic number to provide enough stick the sign has not moved in two months.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy C Walker

customer_reviews.title: Weak weak weak magnets
customer_reviews.text: Like so many other reviewers, I found these magnets to be very weak, they don’t adhere well to each other; tried to use it to replace the magnets on the medicine cabinet in the bathroom, and the adhesion between the pieces is darn near nonexistent. Save your money!!
customer_reviews.author: Lioness

customer_reviews.title: inexpensive, effective magnetic squares
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive but effective magnetic squares. Holding up my fridge write-board as you read. Adhesive on one side -- just peel and stick. Better than magnetic tape because they are all flat and you don't have to cut anything.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I used these for math manipulatives in my classroom. I used them on paper shapes. The shapes stick well on my magnetic dry erase board. The only reason I gave 4 stars for adhesion is because I was able to take them off immediately after I initially stuck them and I moved them to a different spot. It seemed to stick again. I was surprised it came off without any residue from the paper. It may be totally fine and may restick permanently, but I don’t know as of yet. I like the ease of use, size and strength ability for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: RKR

customer_reviews.title: Weak Magnetic Field
customer_reviews.text: These magnets are VERY weak. I tried 12 on the surface under a kitchen cabinet to mount an LED light that weighs 5 ounces. These are way under powered for that task, so I tried adding 12 more to the back of the little light fixture itself, to get “magnet to magnet” holding power. It was still too weak to hold. In their favor, the adhesive on the back is pretty good. It took some effort to get the failed magnet system off of the surfaces afterward.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer Ju!ian Buck

customer_reviews.title: Great for small crafts!
customer_reviews.text: I teach preschool and these little magnets are great for creating manipulatives that go along with our curriculum to practice through play all the important skills. I can make themed alphabet sets or number sorts, etc, laminate them, and then put them on magnets to be used on our filing cabinets or metal boards. They adhere easily and hold the weight of light, laminated cardstock. I liked the slim packaging they arrived in as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer B.

customer_reviews.title: ONLY HOLDS 2 SHEETS OF PAPER or 1 POSTCARD -nothing thicker than that
customer_reviews.text: As advertised, they hold a post card to the fridge, but not two. They held two pieces of 8x10 paper but not three...they just slide off. Most importantly YOU CANNOT USE MULTIPLE MAGNETS TO HOLD UP HEAVIER OR THICKER PIECES OF PAPER! Putting multiple magnets on a 3 sheet stack of 8x10 paper did not work because not a single magnet would hold. The were simple to pull off the backing and stuck to the paper I put them on easily.
customer_reviews.author: Stargazer Lily

customer_reviews.title: Watch the Adhesive - Does Not Stay Stuck
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy these are to use. My only issue is that the last batch I purchased will NOT stay stuck to any of the things I put them on. I have the moths laminated for my classroom calendar, and they keep falling off the board because the magnets came unstuck. I also put them on a laminated weekly sign up sheet, and those keep falling off as well. I guess I got a bad batch because I haven't had these issues before.
customer_reviews.author: JAGodfrey

customer_reviews.title: great magnets. somenpeop
customer_reviews.text: These are great. People expect way too much of little magnets. These are stronger than ones i got in the past. They are as strong as some twice as thick. Used about 10 for a white board about 5 x 11 inches and it doesn't budge whe n the fridge door shuts. Good price and i love that they are together on one sheet so i don't htqve to peel up the little corner of the paper. Adhesive seems good to me. Will buy again when i need more.
customer_reviews.author: goplastic

customer_reviews.title: Not very strong, but work well if you use multiple squares together
customer_reviews.text: I used these to hold up photos in 4"x6" plastic photo sleeves. They would not stay on the wall with 1 magnet, with 2 they stuck but they fell of if lightly brushed. 3 magnets per photo sleeve kept them on pretty solidly. I like that they are thin, so the photos did not stick off the wall very much. I would buy these again. Tip: If you think they aren't sticking, try rotating the magnet a quarter turn.
customer_reviews.author: *BeckyC*

customer_reviews.title: Not very strong
customer_reviews.text: I had to use 8 magnets to hold a mirror that is about 5X7. Since there are 70, it wasn't a big deal, but even with the number of them I used, it will not stick to my metal wall with cloth on it. It will only stick directly to metal. This is disappointing since that's why I bought them in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. I purchased this because I am an online teacher. I needed to create some visual aids for my students. After purchasing a laminator I needed a way to magnetize the visual aids. This was perfect. After I begin to run low I realize that I could cut each magnet square and make even smaller squares to allow the product to go around a little more generously. I had no problem taking the adhesive back off and then re sticking it to another visual aid. It really worked great and there have been no problems. Will buy again when I run out
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Askins

customer_reviews.title: Big Letdown
customer_reviews.text: This product sucks, not magnetic at all, the adhesive sheet it comes on is stronger than the magnet itself
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These magnets seem good so far
customer_reviews.text: These magnets seem good so far. Using them for a project that I will be putting on the door on our cruise. I cut out images and letters on my cricut and laminated them and put the magnets on the back. They are sticking well and seem strong enough when I tested them to hold for the week. I used several magnets on each sheet that I did to be on the safe side. Good product and good price. I shopped around at craft stored and other magnets were more expensive. I also liked the size of the squares so I didn't have to do any cutting.
customer_reviews.author: L. Flynn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for pictures and kids art work on the fridge!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these magnets because I have the bottom half of my fridge full of pictures and wanted to create a collage. These were the perfect solution. I got rid of all the magnets that were holding up the pictures on the outside and now it looks neat and perfect. I have two small children that are always bringing home art work and test they are proud of and these are also perfect for hanging these on the fridge! The adhesive and the magnets have a strong hold and the magnets are precut into perfect little squares. I love these! I will definitely be ordering more!
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Goris

customer_reviews.title: Easy, flat, strong sticky.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for teaching spelling. I make index cards with letters on them and put the magnet on the back so that I can slide the card around around on the whiteboard. These are easier and faster to use than any other magnets I’ve tried yet. The stick is good. They stay on. I tried a roll of sticky magnets before, but they would never flatten out and they kept popping off the index cards.
customer_reviews.author: PM

customer_reviews.title: Poor product doesn't do what it should
customer_reviews.text: I got these in hopes they would be strong enough to hold up some signage paper which isn't very heavy. The backing takes forever to peel off, they don't stick well to surfaces and they do not have the strength to hold themselves on let alone anything else. I really would not suggest this product I was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: The magnets are absolutely worthless. They wouldn’t even hold the lightest of hooks on my refrigerator, much less anything hanging on the hook. A total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Tracye

customer_reviews.title: Really only good for postcards and sheets of paper
customer_reviews.text: The magnets and the adhesive are pretty weak. If you plan to use them for more than a postcard, greeting card, a sheet of paper, etc., then you will be disappointed. Don't plan on using the magnets to hold onto each other either. You'd need a ton of these magnets to hold anything up, and the adhesive isn't very reliable. I wouldn't buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Leclaire

customer_reviews.title: pretty good thin magnets which you can cut
customer_reviews.text: i use these for home made refridgerator magnets. The adhesive could be a little stronger, but you can always add your own glue if you need to. I have not needed to add glue because what I am using them for is very light weight. I also cut these magnets with scisors to fit in small places. overall very good magnets that are very thin.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest
customer_reviews.text: They are only stong enough to keep pitures or paper up. I have 6 in" wooden cirla I painted anf wanted to place them on the fridge, but the often fall down or slid off. Anything that weighs more than 3oz don't bother. Also the sticker immediately loses stickiness when stuck to something, so they're not really reusable.
customer_reviews.author: Kyra

customer_reviews.title: Unstuck!
customer_reviews.text: These are the worst magnets ever. They stuck to nothing, including themselves. Waste of time and money. Returning and going to Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: MrsEvans

customer_reviews.title: Not very strong.  Might be good for holding up a picture to a refridgerator, but thats it.
customer_reviews.text: These magnets work, but they are not very strong magnets. They are at most, good for holding up a picture to a refrigerator and that's it. If you need stronger magnets, get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Debounce

customer_reviews.title: Magnet was Not Strong Enough to Do the Job
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping that these would work on a drawer that keeps sliding open so I placed them on the edges but these magnets are not that strong. Maybe they would be better for craft projects.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little magnets!
customer_reviews.text: I used these little magnets to put on the back of photos and then put the photos on a magnetic bulletin board. It's great because I can move the photos around all I want without having any tape or tacks. I plan to use the magnets to post photos on the refrigerator door, too.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to use for my son's first birthday favors. 4x4 picture is held well with just one magnet, but I used two in every photo to be safe. Only negative I have is the packaging, not the shipping packaging. There's no cardboard packing which made half of the magnets separate from the the white paper protecting the sticky side of the magnet. It comes in a plastic bag and since the magnets are individually attached to the white paper sheet, there's no support.
customer_reviews.author: MJDRCC

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold anything heavier than a postcard
customer_reviews.text: I bought these expecting that 5-6 squares would hold a white board (8X10, weighs about 5 oz), but after 15 squares, it still wasn't sticking to the fridge, which is currently holding several other magnets perfectly. Also tried it on a bag holder (roughly 6 oz - put 25 magnets on it), and it also did not work. Huge disappointment. I imagine this will work to stick up a single 4x6 photo or a post card however!
customer_reviews.author: nicole

customer_reviews.title: A Quality Magnet for DIY
customer_reviews.text: I was using this product for a DIY watercolor pallet. The magnets overall are great. They are strong enough to bond to the magnets on the bottom of my pans to keep them safe during transport but weak enough that it is easy for me to remove and rearrange my the magnets were difficult to neatly cut to a size i needed with a basic scissors and that was important to me since I needed to fit the magnets to a specific sized pallet. Overall im very happy with the performance of the product. They are a good choice for simple DIYs
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: These are garbage! I stuck 6 of them in a photo and couldn't get them to hold!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I wanted them for!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to make a "Do Not Disturb" sign to stick on our metal door. I made the sign (about half a letter size page) and laminated it. I then stuck one of these magnets on each of the four corners and I am very happy. I am not sure what I'll do with the other 66 magnets, but it was worth buying the 70 to be able to use 4.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Works like expected
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product to add to the back of the acrylic magnetic photo frame per recommendation. However, it was needed. I have used the magnets to attach individual photos and important papers to our fridge and it is perfect. I just keep the sheet near the fridge for pictures and papers for easy access.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Not very strong, but great for bobby pins!
customer_reviews.text: Not the strongest, and definitely not strong enough for what I wanted. (I wanted to stick them to my remote and keep it on the metal part of my lamp on which I store other magnetic remotes and things.) I don’t think I understood the description enough to know that these aren’t very strong. I did, however, stick these onto my nightstand, and I keep my bobby pins on them so that I don’t lose them, which is very convenient. At least I figured out a use for them!
customer_reviews.author: Drew & Lauren Carl

customer_reviews.title: Stick 'em Up!
customer_reviews.text: I am using these for multiple applications and they appear to hold my tasks well. They are not your strongest magnet, but for my lightweight use they are perfect. I do like how the sheet is attached and scored rather than individual magnets, much easier to manage. I used them on a mesh desk organizer to hold the drawers closed so they don't slide open when moving the organizer and they hold quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Very useful!
customer_reviews.text: I use these to create magnets out of buttons/nick knacks/etc for my fridge. I've also used it to put up pictures on my fridge. Very handle! The magnet strength really varies. Some are really sturdy and some aren't, not bad for the pricing though!
customer_reviews.author: Mei Leung

customer_reviews.title: They don't stick to each other
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use as a quick fix for my wallet when the clasp broke. The magnets (even a 2x2 grid on each side) aren't strong enough to hold 2 pieces of fabric together. Super disappointed :(
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Parrish

customer_reviews.title: More usable
customer_reviews.text: I'm a first grade teacher and I use magnets to post charts, posters, name tags, etc. on my magnetic white boards. I was grateful to find flat, pre-cut magnet squares to use for this purpose. The other products I have tried: rolled magnetic tape (hard to get to lay flat) and magnet buttons (too thick!) were hard to use. I appreciate the thin, flat sheets of squares. I like the fact that they are self stick as well, so I don't have to use a glue gun to affix them to the display item.
customer_reviews.author: BetteJo McLelland

customer_reviews.title: Stay put very well
customer_reviews.text: I used these magnets to make tea pot shaped refrigerator magnets for our Ladies' Fellowship Tea Party. They were easy to apply and they stay put very well. I put one on crooked and tried to remove it, but gave up. No one will see the magnet anyway once it is on their refrigerator door.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lima

customer_reviews.title: Practical
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these because I wanted to post some things in my class. It is a good product but needs refinement. Unless you are using them all at one time, its difficult to detach them. Maybe if there were more space between the magnets it would be easier to tear or cut the ones you need. Overall, a decent product but I probably wouldn't order them again, for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: NJN

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: These magnets are not magnetic. They can not even support their own weight. They do not hold at all. Maybe I just received a bad batch, but I am returning for refund.
customer_reviews.author: KS14000

customer_reviews.title: Not very strong but work for small paper items
customer_reviews.text: Hoped they would be stronger, but for paper cards or very thin items they are fine for sticking to a fridge to hold up a card. Not good for much more than that. Tried them on a cabinet door to hold close, but they were useless for that - which was my original plan.
customer_reviews.author: DRS

customer_reviews.title: Not useful for heavy items
customer_reviews.text: The magnets are sturdy. Good adhesive. I wanted to use them to attach a small wooden plaque 4x4 to the refrigerator, but it kept sliding down the side of the frig. These are more useful for hanging lighter weight items such as paper.
customer_reviews.author: Sew Genius

customer_reviews.title: Very economic and good quality magnetic squares.
customer_reviews.text: I was desiring the items for bases for miniature wargame figures to stick to a metal movement tray, and they are perfect. I can easily see many other applications for high quality strong magnetic squares as well, but for my purposes they serve perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, affordable product if used as intended.
customer_reviews.text: Used in a craft/school project for moveable lightweight items displayed/used on classroom whiteboard. The squares can be easily cut to increase quantity available and/or stacked to increase height, if needed. Would recommend using a bit of super glue if the magnet is intended to be permanently attached or for heavier items. These would be great for refrigerator art, etc., but use caution with little ones as these can be easily removed (without super glue) and be a potential choking hazard.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Versatile magnets to hang things on locker
customer_reviews.text: These are used to hold things on my work locker. Just break apart what you need, peel off the back (nice sticky back-I feel like it's secured well to the item I want to hang up with the magnets), apply to item and hang on metal surface. I don't know how much weight these could hold but for small stuff they work great!
customer_reviews.author: Blue Roses

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap quality magnets - complete waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Very cheap magnets The sticky side is very cheap Dollar store has better quality than this
customer_reviews.author: neeraj

customer_reviews.title: Did the job!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to be able to hang NYE decor on a metal door. The squares are small as indicated and it took quite a few to hang even lighter items, but it did the job I needed it to do and I am pleased with this product. The sticky part that actually stuck to my sign could have been a little more sticky. I would buy again, however would look for perhaps a stronger magnet, if there's such a thing out there in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Divinity

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly and so easy!
customer_reviews.text: Did exactly what I needed. I use mailbox covers with magnetic strips at the edges. 'some were not long enough and covers buckled. Used stickey side for cover and pressed magnetic side to mailbox. Worked perfectly and so easy!
customer_reviews.author: Tadpole

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution for dirty job.
customer_reviews.text: I placed these magnetic squares inside the bottom surface of the wheel guard for a 1 x 30” belt sander to collect steel grinding debris. Once “loaded” with grinding particles, they are very easily removed from the machine, cleaned, and reinstalled. This is a very effective solution for an otherwise dirty and difficult task.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd Ray Benson

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: These magnets will not even hold something that weighs a few ounces onto a magnetic board. I have used more than one square to no avail. Not only that the adhesive is poor causing the magnet to constantly fall off.
customer_reviews.author: kelly p

customer_reviews.title: Found a new gem
customer_reviews.text: As a teacher, I rely on magnets for a lot in the fall and hope that they power through till spring. I used to order the roll of magnets and then press down on the ends so that they didn't curl. Now, I found these and LOVE them. They are strong, stay flat, and do the job. I ordered 3 packages and ready for next school year.
customer_reviews.author: teach3v

customer_reviews.title: This Product Produces A Very Weak Magnetic Field
customer_reviews.text: This item is as described but the magnetic field each square produces is very weak.
customer_reviews.author: Bob In Alabama

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: The magnets are really light and easy to remove from the backing. While I haven't used anything heavy yet, both the adhesion and the magnet seem to have good strength. I have not exhausted their use cases, yet, but so far they're doing everything I expected!
customer_reviews.author: matt hersh

customer_reviews.title: Check the weight
customer_reviews.text: These magnets are not really very strong. I am giving them a 3 because I did read the item description and reviews ahead of time and thought they would support what I wanted, but they did not. However, the packaging for the item states what they can be used for and they do work for that. This item really needs a better description. Anything heavier than a photograph, business card or sheet of paper will be too heavy.
customer_reviews.author: H. Himes

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and convenient for crafts
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing. I bought them for a chore chart I made for my kids. I was able to cut the magnets in half, attach them to a poster and then decorate the other half to stick to it. Very good quality and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Grosso

customer_reviews.title: Wish I found these long ago
customer_reviews.text: It never occurred to me to even look for small magnets. Then I found these. I love them. They are so easy to use and I really like the size to you can add more if you need to. They are so useful for so many different things. I plan on buying more for others.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Work perfectly fine!
customer_reviews.text: Great little magnets! I use them to make little rewards for when I'm teaching VIPKID students and they work just fine. I'm happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine Porter

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy these
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy these. Do not stick and won’t hold anything up. I put three on a picture to hang on my fridge and they literally wouldn’t hold it up for more than 10 min at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not strong
customer_reviews.text: They weren't strong enough for our application. They've already been thrown away. One square couldn't hold itself to the fridge.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Weak magnet.
customer_reviews.text: These are very weak magnets and didn’t even hold to my fridge by themselves. If you’re looking for weakness, you’ve found it here.
customer_reviews.author: KirinChimera

customer_reviews.title: Great for small projects
customer_reviews.text: So far, I love these magnets. They are perfect for the mini canvas squares I bought. I have been hand painting the canvas squares then putting the magnets on them to use as fancy refrigerator magnets. They stick really well to the back of the canvases and haven’t had any issues with them coming off.
customer_reviews.author: Angela V

customer_reviews.title: and it holds fine. For the low price I am very willing ...
customer_reviews.text: To those who are saying they're not very strong, it does specify in the description what they can hold. Even then, I can stick six on my heavier notepad, place two thicker different magnets that I already had underneath to support it, and it holds fine. For the low price I am very willing to improvise.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Prince

customer_reviews.title: Did not work at all
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a arts and crafts project for my kids and they did not stick at all nor did they adhere to the refrigerator. Not pleased at all with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha C.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Not magnetic at all. I’m not sure what the point is.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Dimmick

customer_reviews.title: Great magnets!
customer_reviews.text: Used for Halloween pumpkins for my daughters class. They adhered perfectly and stuck great to the fridge. Price is cheap and product is great! Just what I needed, and I have tons left over!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Martin

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy
customer_reviews.text: These quickly fell off my items. I had to buy a different magnetic strip. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Kari A. Delaney

customer_reviews.title: WOW!!!
customer_reviews.text: This product... WOW! Adheres beautiful and such a strong magnet in a small package. I bought three sheets of this product to use on props for my online TESOL classes and they are magnificent. I may have to order some more before too much longer. This product is a must buy and buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slightly larger than measurement given.
customer_reviews.text: Despite careful measuring (yes twice!) these were slightly too large for my project. I had to trim each one, so project was time-consuming. I will continue using them, but will look for smaller size in future.
customer_reviews.author: Wrestling woman

customer_reviews.title: Very weak magnets
customer_reviews.text: This is a quantity vs quality magnet. You get a lot quantity out of these magnets because they aren't very good. They have a very weak magnetic hold. Definitely would not recommend these magnets
customer_reviews.author: Richard J.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty disappointing
customer_reviews.text: They might work just for attaching paper to a fridge, but they aren't strong and dont really attract to each other. I'm disappointed with them honestly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ehhhh
customer_reviews.text: They sure are light weight. All they hold up is photos. That’s about it. Don’t plan on holding something more than 1 pound on 2 magents.
customer_reviews.author: KRristina

customer_reviews.title: Easy and convenient
customer_reviews.text: Love love love these things. Great to slap on the back of school flyers, handout, or photos. My son likes to put them on the back of his Polaroid pics and use them as magnets or other things. Will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Bernadette

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen cabinet doors are typically not parallel to matching sides ...
customer_reviews.text: Kitchen cabinet doors are typically not parallel to matching sides. It is why we need stronger magnet than this product. Another thing I noticed was that magnet strength was cut to half in off 90 degree position. You need to find power strength by rotating magnet.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Iwai

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: I’m a teacher and I use these for EVERYTHING. They stick well, are strong magnets, and I keep buying more and more. I have also cut the squares down to smaller sizes and they still hold great.
customer_reviews.author: Kally

customer_reviews.title: Good little magnets.
customer_reviews.text: These are good little magnets. The self- stick back is strong and seems to hold really well. The magnets are strong as well. I needed narrow strips for my project and they were easy to cut to size with a pair of scissors. I attached one magnet cut into 3 strips to the backs of decorated clothespins and they are able to hold the weight of 2 or 3 sheets of paper without sliding down the surface they're hung on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for teachers
customer_reviews.text: I have bought these 2 times so far and they are the best thing I've used for my classroom. For reference I have Velcro on the back and this magnet. The magnet is higher than the Velcro and it works well for putting daily check in on the white board as they don't interfere with each other. I'm finding I'm putting these magnets on everything and I'm peeling off all my old magnet tape that barely holds and replacing with these. I'll be a forever fan!
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: A Teacher's Friend!
customer_reviews.text: I use these a lot in the classroom. I make anchor charts or other visual aides and laminate them then attach the magnetic squares to stick them on the whiteboard. So much better than using blue tack or sticky tack on magnetic whiteboards.
customer_reviews.author: Overseas Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I used these to stick to the edge of plastic sheeting too make magnetic doors that close and click shut. Its heavy black plastic. The magnets behavior is orthogonal meaning if two mags repel then simply rotate one mag 90 degrees and they will attract. So be mindful of that when installing if using to attract to itself.
customer_reviews.author: OogeyBoogey

customer_reviews.title: WEAK!
customer_reviews.text: The package claims that the magnets will stick to themselves. Yes, they do... BUT BARELY! I was so frustrated with this.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: amazing - game changer for my walls
customer_reviews.text: so perfect for metal walls... i have tried everything under the sun, hot glue works ok but nothing has fallen off with these... we even missed two weeks of school due to Hurricane Harvey and I know the ac was not on in the bldg the whole time, so even with all that humidity, nothing fell
customer_reviews.author: Ang

customer_reviews.title: simple and effective
customer_reviews.text: The packaging says they can stick to each other, but that doesn't work very well. it works perfectly for small refrigerator magnet project I was doing.
customer_reviews.author: AngieT.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product
customer_reviews.text: These are easy to use and have great strength and stick well to many different surfaces. I have used them on plastic, paper, and laminations. Will definitely be purchasing more.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I used 5 on a wood tile about 6” square. Center and all 4 corners. Made a magnet out of it for my fridge. Sticks well using all of them.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Smith

customer_reviews.title: Product is as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Was what I expected. Using them to hang decorations. Easily hold up light weight items. Only criticism is the paper on the back where the adhesive is tears too easily and rips off the paper from magnets I am not using. So just remove the magnets gently to prevent this from happening
customer_reviews.author: Meg and Mac

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: These work way better than the magnetic tape I had used before I found these. I use these on my classroom posters that I put on my whiteboard and they stay even with middle schoolers moving past them.
customer_reviews.author: AReyOfSunshine

customer_reviews.title: EXACTLY what i needed
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to attach a larger note pad to my refrigerator. Works like a charm - I put the squares all around and not just at the top. Great value too. And quantity will last me for a long time of needing magnetic squares. Nice when something works out like you expected. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Terry

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to well!
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight, thin magnets, I used them to mount my Dolphins &Boomer pin to my "drinks frig". Also mounted a small plastic cast ships plaque. Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rob W.

customer_reviews.title: Necessary for magnetic bulletin boards.
customer_reviews.text: I used these for the magnetic bulletin board at Starbucks. If you are hanging flyers, remember to take these.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon West

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: These magnets are not as strong as I was expecting. Using them to depot eye shadows and they barely stay in place. I also used a couple to keep the shower curtain closed to keep the toilet paper dry and they are very polarized and will repel one another if the wrong sides are placed together.
customer_reviews.author: Prudence

customer_reviews.title: Great magnets
customer_reviews.text: These magnets have worked well for attaching to laminated items and then sticking them on a whiteboard/stacking them together to store (have not stuck stack to whiteboard)
customer_reviews.author: PerryP

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my boyfriend's work truck and he said they worked well. I tried to get more information for this review but that's all he said lol typical
customer_reviews.author: Caylee

customer_reviews.title: Would fall off
customer_reviews.text: I am a teacher, and I bought these magnets to put behind laminated 8 by 11 posters. Every morning that I came in, the posters and/or magnets had fallen down from the white board. I even tried hot glue gun behind the magnets STILL the next morning they were not on the white board. I would not recommend these magnets.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: These small lightweight squares were perfect for hanging my whiteboard calendar on my fridge. They also work great for postcards, pictures or anything else light you want to hang.
customer_reviews.author: KM84

customer_reviews.title: Not very strong magnets
customer_reviews.text: Weak strength. I just wanted to hold up a very small whiteboard on the fridge. I attached as many of these as I could to the borders and it still would not hold to the refrigerator. Normally I’d say the whiteboard was too heavy. But I bought these as a replacement for the small magnet flats that came with the board. (My kids ripped the old ones off). So these are just weak strength.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Brooks

product_meta.title: Magnefic Magnetic Squares, 1 Tape Sheet of 70 Magnetic Squares (each 20x20x2mm), Magnet on one Side, Self Adhesive on the other Side. Perfect for Fridge Organisation, Art Project, Vision Board
feature_bullets: GOOD QUALITY MAGNETS: Objects weighing up to 50 grams can be held easily by a couple of squares. A postcard weighs about 6 to 7 grams. One magnet by itself can easily hold a business card weighing up to 10 grams. Magnefic!
GOOD QUALITY ADHESIVE: Adhesive lasts a long time. Be careful though to apply enough pressure when sticking it to an object.
PLENTY OF SQUARES: 70 squares allow for a lot of creativity. Under normal use of hanging various postcards and papers on the fridge, 70 squares can last you quite some time!
EASY TO USE: Peel of a square and stick it to your object of interest. It's as easy as 1, 2, 3!

ENDLESS POSSIBILITIES: Magnets can be used for sticking practical information or good memories on the fridge, magnets are behind paper instead of on top: a clean and clutterless look. Squares can be used for DIY art projects, they can be used for vision boards, to make your own fridge magnets, to hold up little iron objects etc..

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,934 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
